review_title: Great People But Not Sustainable Long Term
pros:
Exposure to the Arts.
Career focused on culture and the community.
Great team of staff to work with.
Interesting projects to work on.
The directors I worked with were excellent mentors and leaders.
cons:
Below average salaries (even for non-profits).
Very long working hours.
No investment in professional development (below a directors role).
Very high turnover.
Health benefits are co-pay. 
No other additional benefits are offered to staff (*aside from tickets to attend concerts which is a nice perk).

pros:
Since the lockout in 2004, it's been relatively stable.
Musicians foster a generally supportive, positive environment.
Over recent seasons, many younger musicians have joined with beneficial effect on artistic level and general attitude.
cons:
Lower paying than peer orchestras in Vancouver, Edmonton. 
Some musicians complain of too many Pops-type concerts. 
Workload can be quite heavy for certain sections.
